word: The time for Israel's deliverance had come. But God's purpose was to be accomplished in a manner to pour contempt on human pride. The deliverer was to go forth as a humble shepherd, with only a rod in his hand; but God would make that rod the symbol of His power. Leading his flocks one day near Horeb, "the mountain of God," Moses saw a bush in flames. . . . A voice from out of the flame called him by name. With trembling lips he answered, "Here am I." He was warned not to approach irreverently. . . .
